name: Bench Press - Close Grip (Barbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the bar with a close grip, hands about shoulder-width apart.
Lift the bar off the rack and hold it above your chest with arms extended.
Lower the bar slowly to the middle of your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Return the bar to the rack carefully after your final rep.

name: Bicep Cable Curl Rope
summary: Attach a rope handle to a low pulley on a cable machine.
Grab the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
Stand upright with your elbows close to your torso.
Curl the rope toward your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Squeeze at the top, then slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
Repeat with controlled movement.

name: Bicep Curl (Barbell)
summary: Stand upright holding a barbell with an underhand grip, hands about shoulder-width apart.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and your core engaged.
Curl the barbell up by contracting your biceps, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Lift the bar until it reaches shoulder level and squeeze your biceps at the top.
Lower the barbell back down slowly with control.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Bicep Curl (Cable)
summary: Attach a straight bar to a low pulley cable.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and grab the bar with an underhand grip.
Keep your elbows close to your sides and your chest up.
Curl the bar toward your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Pause briefly at the top, then lower the bar with control.
Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps.

name: Bicep Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing forward.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and engage your core.
Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders by bending your elbows.
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back down with control.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Bicep Curl (Machine)
summary: Sit down and adjust the seat and arm pad so your upper arms are supported.
Grasp the handles with an underhand grip and arms fully extended.
Curl the handles toward your shoulders by bending your elbows.
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
Lower the handles back to the starting position with control.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Cable Triceps Kickback
summary: Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine.
Hold the handle in one hand and hinge at the hips with your back flat.
Keep your upper arm in line with your torso and elbow bent at 90 degrees.
Extend your arm back by straightening your elbow.
Squeeze your triceps at the top, then return to the starting position.
Repeat and switch arms as needed.

name: Concentration Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, letting the dumbbell hang.
Curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary.
Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbell with control back to the starting position.
Repeat for reps, then switch arms.

name: Hammer Curl (Cable)
summary: Attach a rope to a low pulley and grab it with both hands, palms facing each other.
Stand upright with elbows close to your torso.
Curl the rope up while keeping your palms facing each other.
Pause at the top and squeeze your biceps.
Lower the rope slowly back to the starting position.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Hammer Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your sides.
Keep your elbows close to your torso.
Curl the dumbbells while maintaining the neutral grip.
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Incline Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down.
Keep your palms facing forward and elbows close to your body.
Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still.
Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the starting position.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Preacher Curl (Barbell)
summary: Sit at a preacher curl bench and grasp a barbell with an underhand grip.
Rest your upper arms on the pad and extend your arms fully.
Curl the barbell up by contracting your biceps.
Pause at the top and squeeze your biceps.
Lower the bar back down with control.
Repeat for reps while keeping your arms on the pad.

name: Preacher Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Sit at a preacher bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
Rest your upper arm on the pad and let the dumbbell hang.
Curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary.
Pause and squeeze your bicep at the top.
Lower the dumbbell back with control.
Repeat for reps, then switch arms.

name: Preacher Curl (Machine)
summary: Sit on the preacher curl machine with your upper arms resting on the pad.
Grasp the handles with an underhand grip.
Curl the handles toward your shoulders, squeezing your biceps.
Pause at the top of the movement.
Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
Repeat with control for your desired number of reps.

name: Reverse Curl (Barbell)
summary: Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and your core tight.
Curl the barbell up while keeping your palms facing down.
Squeeze your forearms and biceps at the top.
Lower the bar slowly with control.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Reverse Curl (Dumbbell)
summary: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Keep your elbows tucked in and arms extended.
Curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders, palms still facing down.
Pause at the top, then slowly lower the weights.
Keep the motion controlled throughout.
Repeat for reps.

name: Skullcrusher (Barbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench holding a barbell with a narrow overhand grip.
Extend your arms so the bar is over your chest.
Lower the bar toward your forehead by bending your elbows.
Stop just before the bar touches your head.
Press the bar back up to the starting position.
Repeat with control for the desired reps.

name: Skullcrusher (Dumbbell)
summary: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended overhead.
Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells toward your head.
Stop just short of your forehead or ears.
Extend your arms to return to the start.
Keep your upper arms stationary throughout.
Repeat for your desired number of reps.

name: Triceps Dip
summary: Position yourself between parallel bars and hold your body up with straight arms.
Lean slightly forward to emphasize the triceps.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms form about a 90-degree angle.
Push through your palms to lift back up.
Keep your elbows tucked in throughout the motion.
Repeat while maintaining control.

name: Triceps Dip (Assisted)
summary: Set up an assisted dip machine or use a band for support.
Hold onto the handles and position your knees on the pad or band.
Lower yourself by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.
Keep your torso slightly leaned forward.
Repeat with control.

name: Triceps Extension (Cable)
summary: Attach a straight or rope handle to a high pulley.
Grab the handle with both hands and step back slightly.
Keep your elbows close to your head and arms bent.
Extend your arms forward or downward to straighten them.
Squeeze your triceps at full extension.
Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Triceps Extension (Barbell)
summary: Hold a barbell with both hands and raise it overhead with arms extended.
Keep your elbows pointing forward and close to your head.
Lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Pause briefly, then press the barbell back up.
Avoid flaring your elbows during the movement.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Triceps Extension (Dumbbell)
summary: Hold a single dumbbell with both hands and raise it overhead.
Keep your elbows close to your ears and your core tight.
Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Pause, then press the dumbbell back up until your arms are straight.
Repeat while maintaining good form.
Keep your upper arms stationary throughout.

name: Triceps Extension (Machine)
summary: Sit at the triceps extension machine and adjust the seat and pad.
Grab the handles with your arms bent and elbows aligned with the pivot point.
Push the handles down until your arms are fully extended.
Squeeze your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat with control.

name: Triceps Pushdown (Cable)
summary: Attach a straight bar or rope to a high pulley.
Stand upright and grab the handle with an overhand grip.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and forearms parallel to the floor.
Push the handle down until your arms are fully extended.
Squeeze your triceps at the bottom.
Return to the start with control and repeat.

name: Wrist Roller
summary: Hold the wrist roller with both hands at shoulder height.
Slowly rotate your wrists to wind the weight upward.
Keep your arms extended and wrists steady.
Unroll the rope slowly to lower the weight back down.
Maintain control during both directions.
Repeat for multiple sets as needed.
